title: The topological holonomy group and the complexity of horizontality
abstract:
In [2], it is observed that if in the twistor space associated with an
oriented vector bundle of rank $4$ with a positive-definite metric and a metric
connection, the horizontality has infinite complexity derived from one of the
cases studied in [1], then the complexity is expressed by a dense subset of
$S^2$. In the present paper, it is observed that in such a situation, the
topological holonomy group is dense in $SO(3)$.
